conversations.body_text: Hi Nicolas MENEY,  Could you also test with SIMHUB 9.9.3 to see if the same issue occurs? In addition, may I ask which brand of wheelbase you are using? Please also check whether your PC is properly grounded.

Hi Nicolas MENEY,  For a small number of Pro X Ultra control boxes, there may be slight inaccuracies in the force display. For example, the red curve should be close to 60kg at full brake travel, but the displayed value might not be entirely correct. However, this does not affect normal usage. When calibrating, simply apply your usual pedal force during the calibration process. In addition, Fanatec DD wheelbases can cause significant interference. For the motor issue, I will provide you with a detailed troubleshooting procedure.      In addition, could you please provide your order details as well, so that we can assist you accordingly?      To address EMI (Electromagnetic Interference) issues, please follow the steps below to improve device stability and USB connection reliability:     1.    Ensure proper grounding: Make sure the computer is connected to a three-prong outlet with a reliable ground. Two-prong plugs do not provide grounding.     2.    Control box grounding: Use a green shielding wire to connect the metal housing (such as a copper post or screw) of the control box to any metal screw on the pedal. Ensure the contact point is paint-free and conductive.     3.    Base grounding (e.g., Fanatec / MOZA): It’s recommended to connect the metal part of the base to the PC chassis or an external ground to discharge static buildup.     4.    Avoid high-interference zones: Keep USB cables away from high-voltage power lines or adapters; route cables separately where possible.     5.    Use direct USB connection: Connect devices directly to a rear USB 3.0 port on the PC instead of using unpowered or low-quality USB hubs.     6.    Use USB cables with ferrite cores: If needed, switch to high-quality USB cables with ferrite beads to reduce high-frequency interference.     7.    Keep software and firmware updated: Ensure SIMSONN Manager and firmware are updated to the latest version, as some updates include EMI handling improvements.     8.    Use a USB isolator: If the above methods don’t resolve the issue, using a USB isolator is recommended. It physically separates the USB power and data lines, effectively shielding the control device from EMI sources.     https://github.com/SHWotever/SimHub/wiki/USB-Issues-Troubleshooting https://support.gomezsimindustries.com/portal/en/kb/articles/understanding-emi-and-grounding

合并来自工单2949  
      主题: Connection problem VAM PRO  
      描述:  Hello, following my purchase of the Pro X Ultra pedals and the Haptic Vam Pro from your website, I'm contacting you because I can't get the haptic feedback to work. 
 It would be nice if you could provide a manual for this in the future, and if possible in French, that would be even better, but that's another matter. 
 Could you help me because when I launch my game, on some games like Le Mans Ultimate, when I activate ABS and traction control, as soon as I press the brake, it automatically triggers, even when almost stationary when the car isn't moving. For the TC, it triggers when I pass over the kerbs, even though I'm in TC mode. 
 Could you help me? 
 Thanks in advance.  
 
 Nicolas Meney.  
   
 Envoyé depuis l'application Mail Orange

Hi Nicolas MENEY,  Has your issue been resolved? If you are still concerned about the force display, we can send you a replacement Pro X Ultra control box. In addition, for the brake’s VAM Pro, we recommend using 4 nylon screws and washers, which can effectively isolate VAM Pro interference on the brake signal. The throttle and clutch are not affected, as their sensors are made from non-metallic materials.
Hi Nicolas MENEY,  Please provide your order number along with your contact name, phone number, and address, and we will arrange the reshipment for you today.

 Hi Nicolas MENEY, 
 
   
 For a small number of Pro X Ultra control boxes, there may be slight inaccuracies in the force display. For example, the red curve should be close to 60kg at full brake travel, but the displayed value might not be entirely correct. However, this does not affect normal usage. When calibrating, simply apply your usual pedal force during the calibration process. 
 
 In addition, Fanatec DD wheelbases can cause significant interference. For the motor issue, I will provide you with a detailed troubleshooting procedure.  
 
 
   
 In addition, could you please provide your order details as well, so that we can assist you accordingly?  
 
   
 
 To address EMI (Electromagnetic Interference) issues, please follow the steps below to improve device stability and USB connection reliability: 
 
 
    1.    Ensure proper grounding: Make sure the computer is connected to a three-prong outlet with a reliable ground. Two-prong plugs do not provide grounding. 
 
 
    2.    Control box grounding: Use a green shielding wire to connect the metal housing (such as a copper post or screw) of the control box to any metal screw on the pedal. Ensure the contact point is paint-free and conductive. 
 
 
    3.    Base grounding (e.g., Fanatec / MOZA): It’s recommended to connect the metal part of the base to the PC chassis or an external ground to discharge static buildup. 
 
 
    4.    Avoid high-interference zones: Keep USB cables away from high-voltage power lines or adapters; route cables separately where possible. 
 
 
    5.    Use direct USB connection: Connect devices directly to a rear USB 3.0 port on the PC instead of using unpowered or low-quality USB hubs. 
 
 
    6.    Use USB cables with ferrite cores: If needed, switch to high-quality USB cables with ferrite beads to reduce high-frequency interference. 
 
 
    7.    Keep software and firmware updated: Ensure SIMSONN Manager and firmware are updated to the latest version, as some updates include EMI handling improvements. 
 
 
    8.    Use a USB isolator: If the above methods don’t resolve the issue, using a USB isolator is recommended. It physically separates the USB power and data lines, effectively shielding the control device from EMI sources. 
 
 
   
 
 
https://github.com/SHWotever/SimHub/wiki/USB-Issues-Troubleshooting

    4.    Avoid high-interference zones: Keep USB cables away from high-voltage power lines or adapters; route cables separately where possible. 
 
 
    5.    Use direct USB connection: Connect devices directly to a rear USB 3.0 port on the PC instead of using unpowered or low-quality USB hubs.
